name: user_intentions
description: List of atomic user intentions extracted from the latest user message for downstream planning while designing a task specification.

tasks.name: main_intent
tasks.description: Single, concise sentence describing what the user wants or expects for this intention, typically in relation to some part of the task spec.

class_definitions.ask_question: The user is asking for information or an explanation (e.g., how to design part of the task spec).
class_definitions.request_action: The user is asking the assistant/system to perform an action or make a change (e.g., rewrite a section of the task spec).
class_definitions.provide_information: The user is providing information or data about their task, domain, or constraints without directly requesting an action.
class_definitions.clarification_or_followup: The user is clarifying a previous turn, refining a request, or following up on earlier content about the task spec.
class_definitions.feedback_or_evaluation: The user is giving feedback, complaints, or evaluation about the assistant/system or its proposed task spec.
class_definitions.meta_or_configuration: The user is changing instructions, preferences, or configuration about how the assistant/system should help design the task.
class_definitions.chit_chat: The user is engaging in small talk or social interaction without a concrete task-spec-related goal.

tasks.name: priority
tasks.description: Relative priority of this intent from 1 (lowest) to 5 (highest), based on urgency, blocking nature for progressing the task spec, or explicit user emphasis.

tasks.name: clarification_status
tasks.description: Whether additional clarification from the user is required before acting on this intent.

class_definitions.clarification_required: More information from the user is needed before the planner can safely or effectively act on this intent.
class_definitions.clarification_not_required: The intent is clear enough for the planner to proceed without additional clarification from the user.

tasks.name: clarification_question
tasks.description: If clarification_status is 'clarification_required', the single most important clarification question to ask the user; otherwise an empty string.

tasks.name: related_context
tasks.description: Which assignment/task metadata structures this intent primarily depends on or refers to.

class_definitions.task_goal: The intent depends on or refers to the task's Goal section (Context and Core Objective).
class_definitions.input_data_description: The intent depends on or refers to the Data section describing the source, content, and properties of the input data.
class_definitions.task_detailed_instructions: The intent depends on or refers to Detailed Instructions and Task Criteria (what correct behavior/labels look like).
class_definitions.task_global_guidelines: The intent depends on or refers to Global Guidelines (cross-cutting principles, preferences, ambiguity handling, etc.).
class_definitions.task_author_notes: The intent depends on or refers to the Authorâ€™s Note (high-level intent or priorities of the task designer).
class_definitions.input_data_schema: The intent depends on or refers to the formal schema/structure of the input data (e.g., fields or JSON structure).
class_definitions.output_data_schema: The intent depends on or refers to the formal schema/structure of the expected output (e.g., labels, fields, JSON structure).
